metadata.label: Career Switcher
metadata.description: Transitioning into tech from a different field

heroContext.subtitle: Welcome to tech - your journey starts here!
heroContext.subtext: Your non-tech background is actually an asset - unique perspective + fresh learning mindset

companiesInsightAdaptation.title: Company Fit for Career Switchers
companiesInsightAdaptation.subtitle: Where your unique background is valued
companiesInsightAdaptation.emphasis: Companies hire career switchers for your fresh perspective, different thinking, and high motivation. Focus on companies that value learning potential over pure experience.

interviewPreparationContext.title: Interview Preparation for Career Switchers
interviewPreparationContext.subtitle: Your interviews will be slightly different - here's what to expect
interviewPreparationContext.emphasis: Interviewers understand you're new to tech. They'll assess: fundamentals, learning ability, problem-solving mindset, and motivation

keyAreas.description: Strong grasp of core concepts you've learned
keyAreas.focus: Explain concepts clearly - show you understand, not just memorized

keyAreas.description: How you approach and break down problems
keyAreas.focus: Show your thinking process - this matters more than getting it perfect

keyAreas.description: Demonstrate hunger to learn and adapt
keyAreas.focus: Share examples of how you learned quickly in your past career

keyAreas.description: How your previous experience applies to tech
keyAreas.focus: Communication, collaboration, project management from your past role

learningPathAdaptation.title: Comprehensive Learning for Career Switchers
learningPathAdaptation.emphasis: We'll build everything from the ground up - fundamentals first, then specialized

projectsAdaptation.title: Portfolio Building for Career Switchers
projectsAdaptation.subtitle: These projects prove you can build real things
projectsAdaptation.guidance: Start with smaller, focused projects to build confidence and portfolio. Quality over quantity - 3 well-built projects are better than 10 rushed ones.

skillGapAdaptation.title: Your Learning Roadmap
skillGapAdaptation.subtitle: From zero to job-ready in your new career
skillGapAdaptation.approach: We're building a comprehensive curriculum that takes you from fundamentals to production-ready

timelineContext.reasoning: You're building from scratch, but the timeline is realistic and achievable
timelineContext.note: We've added 20% to timelines to account for learning from zero, but you can accelerate with focused effort

companies: Look for companies that actively hire career switchers
Smaller companies and startups are often more open
Focus on learning culture, not just prestige
firstRole: Your first role might not be your dream role - that's okay
Prioritize learning and growth over title
Build 2-3 years of experience, then transition if needed
impact: Your unique background gives you a competitive advantage
Show coachability and eagerness to learn
Build a strong portfolio to offset lack of experience

points.description: You bring ideas from your previous industry - companies value diversity of thought
You chose tech deliberately - shows commitment and passion
You likely have professional experience and work ethic
Communication, project management, domain knowledge from your previous role
You won't be constrained by 'how we've always done it in tech'
